attributes.action: Plant more trees in national parks and local communities!
attributes.background:
By using land that is free from agriculture and future urban expansion to plant trees, we can help Britain lead in combating climate change!

Working with farmers to utilise their free space for more trees, increasing forestland in national parks and working with local councils to help plant trees
attributes.additional_details:
This project would create jobs as well as working with existing companies, could utilise the younger generation into it by offering part time/full time work, or volunteering programmes.

This would help Britain send a message to the rest of the world in one solution for combating climate change. This would be a great investment for our country in so many ways, both short term and long term. 

Let's make Britain green!

attributes.action: Allow parliamentary time for a Bill for democratic reform of the House of Lords
attributes.background: Between 2001 and 2015 successive parliaments failed to agree on Bills to complete the work of the 1999 House of Lords Act by creating a democratic elected Second Chamber. In the last parliament a House of Lords Reform Bill passed its Second Reading in the Lords but was given no further time.
attributes.additional_details: An elected Second Chamber was first discussed in the 1911 Parliament Act, and again in the 1999 House of Lords Act. In 2015 all the major parties promised Lords reform in their election manifestos, but only a Private Members Bill was brought forward. That Bill was a compromise proposal aimed at finding the consensus which had eluded the attempts of the previous Coalition and Labour Governments. That consensus can only be found if sufficient time is allowed for debate.

attributes.action: Don’t scrap the 1p or 2p coin
attributes.background: Recently there have been calls for the 1p and 2p coin to be scrapped. I believe that this would have a huge effect of the UK public, This would mean any tax increases would jump to a minimum of 5p, that has an effect on petrol prices, shop prices would increase, leaving the British public worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets etc would increase prices by 5p per item when they do increase a price, for eg, Mr & Mrs Public go shopping to their local supermarket, the store has had a store wide increase on tinned goods, so the couple buy 20 tins of varied products, all of which have had an increase of 5p, thats an extra £1 on that shop alone, £52 a year rise in costs, that’s just on one example of shopping, let alone the other rises, to jump from a 1p rise to a 5p rise is too much for a lot of people.

attributes.action: a maximum amount to be specified for school uniforms
attributes.background: School uniforms are now ridiculously expensive and even primarily schools are now setting excessive rules on school uniforms.  Parents are effectively paying hundreds of pounds in “fees” just to send a child to school.  Parents should not have pay for these excessive uniforms
attributes.additional_details: Schools should be ordered to set a maximum amount of £50 for the whole uniform and any costs in excess of this must be bourne by the school.  This would also prevent schools from selecting one supplier who can then dictate the price people pay.  As education is mandatory parents should not be forced into paying excessive amounts just to send a child to school

attributes.action: The cost of a colour TV licence should be cut to £100.
attributes.background:
BBC news and current affairs programmes are no longer of high quality.
In an age of austerity where ordinary people are struggling to make ends meet, a licence fee of £150 is no longer justified for substandard broadcasting.
attributes.additional_details:
As a national broadcaster, the BBC is expected to be fearless, objective and impartial in its reporting of news and current affairs programming.
The BBC often avoids or downplays politically sensitive news items, allows statements to go unchallenged and uses false equivalence to counter balance expert opinion.
These are not the attributes expected of a national broadcaster in a leading democratic nation.

attributes.action: Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges while on duty.
attributes.background:
Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges.

Lights and/or siren not required to be active for exemption.

Only requirement is for staff to be on duty (on call) but not restricted to being on a call and is to include brake times.
attributes.additional_details: www.express.co.uk/news/uk/993969/parking-warden-ticket-paramedics-north-west-ambulance-service/amp

attributes.action: Legalise the usage and possession of Psychedelic drugs.
attributes.background:
There is astounding reports of these substances changing many people's lives, tackling depression and mental health issues.
We would like the laws reevaluated in order for proper clinical testing to take place.
We believe these substances will have a great impact in the field of psychiatry.
attributes.additional_details:
Dimethyltryptamine is a naturally occurring chemical in all of nature's plants. The human body is said to possibly produce this chemical and we currently do not know enough about this substance due to its legal status.

Research needs to be done into the potential medicinal benefits of this substance to tackle chronic depression etc.

attributes.action: Ban the use of straws and plastic packaging in the UK
attributes.background: Plastic is polluting the ocean. Marine species then eat it causing plastic toxins to be absorbed into their body and enter the food chain. The plastic in their environment can also hurt the animals.

attributes.action: Increase fines for leaving animals in cars
attributes.background: Increase fines to £5000 and be banned from keeping dogs for life

attributes.action: Reason 4 Change seeks to have ‘never spent convictions’ rule changed.
attributes.background: We ask for either a new ‘case by case’ filter system for historical convictions or for the ‘4 year + sentence equals never spent’ rule to be moved to 7 years + instead. Once at least 10 years has past and no further offences have been committed, there needs to be eligibility for a ‘spent’ status.
attributes.additional_details: Unecessary life-time disclosure causes sustained upset, distress and humiliation. Being asked for disclosure of convictions for such things as car and home insurance creates regular stress and anxiety for many individuals. Applications which are NOT exempt from the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 still have the right to ask this question which in turn raises unnecessary discrimination. The current situation is causing unfair alienation and separation. Please help Reason 4 Change by signing.

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty for child murderers, rapists and paedophiles.
attributes.background: The death penalty should be brought back for people who abuse and murder young babies and children or who rape babies and young children. There is no cure for pure evil or pedophillia and almost everyone who gets convicted of any of these crime almost always certainly go on to do the same again.

attributes.action: Remove the use of 'British Empire' in the UK honours system.
attributes.background:
This petition aims to remove the use of 'British Empire' in UK honorary titles, ending the continuation of colonial language. 

E.g. 'Member of The British Empire' (MBE)
E.g. 'Officer of The British Empire (CBE)

Such awards should be reformed, finally bringing these titles into the modern age.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all UK social workers to wear body cameras
attributes.background: Service users have made allegations with no way of proving if a worker is treating them unfairly. It should be a legal requirement for social workers to wear body cameras to establish if this is the case.
attributes.additional_details: There have been cases in the headlines of children wrongfully removing from their families. There are Facebook groups of parents desperately trying to get their children home, usually without success. There are news articles and court hearings that have exposed mis-information, unfortunately children may have already been traumatised after being removed from their home, resulting in mental health issues, attachments issues and a ruined childhood.

attributes.action: Publicly reject Action on Sugar's call for a "milkshake ban"
attributes.background:
Action on Sugar, a British pressure group, has called for all milkshakes with more than 300 calories to be banned for health reasons. 

This is absurd, and would be a huge government overreach. Large, thick milkshakes are a tasty occasional treat, and virtually everyone treats them as such.
attributes.additional_details:
Action on Sugar is basing their wild demand for a ban based on the ridiculous assumption that these kinds of milkshakes would be "consumed on a daily basis", to quote their own chairman Graham McGregor.

The government should publicly state that they are not seriously considering this proposal. The obesity crisis is serious, but this is not the solution.

BBC report: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-46179175?SThisFB&fbclid=IwAR2_MwWYdlQU4p8SeoADkSdm40-8ajWkqgkqdzXQTKH0iXH0tz0U2qpM3a0

attributes.action: life in prison for those that cause death through drink driving
attributes.background: As a biker I know of far too many lives affected throughbdrink driving

attributes.action: Name one of Her Majesties warships HMS Walker
attributes.background: Captain Walker was a superb Captain in WW2 in anti submarine warfare and died aged 48 in 1944. He was a highly decorated officer who died from exhaustion and overwork in 1944, his son was killed onboard HMSubmarine Parthian in 1943.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederic_John_Walker

Walker sank more U-boats during the Battle of the Atlantic than any other British or Allied commander, and he was instrumental in the Allied victory of the Battle of the Atlantic.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to partake in and advertise 'trophy' hunting in the UK.
attributes.background: Recent posts on social media from Scotland show trophy hunters posing with deer, goats and even sheep which they have shot. Hunting is a contentious issue in the UK, but this type of hunting is purely based on commercial interests, often making profit for companies in other countries.

attributes.action: Require all supermarkets to have an Eco packaging/Local produce/Vegan section
attributes.background: People know of the harm that use of plastic/meat and dairy industry/food flown thousands of miles is having on the planet and are doing all they can, but options are limited and that makes people feel there's not much they can help with. So with this petition we require ALL supermarkets to have:
attributes.additional_details:
1.ECO Section: include zero- plastic products - 'naked' veg and fruit; grains, bread, pasta, spices packaged in paper; milk, oils, juices in glass bottles; toiletries - solid shampoos, conditioners, toothpaste, deodorants
 
2.Local Produce Section: to reduce carbon footprint of our shopping, consumers should be able to easily find products grown locally.
 
3.Increase vegan produce at least two-fold, stocking a reasonable selection in local stores as well, giving eco friendly options to everyone

attributes.action: Make new commercial buildings have solar panels unless good reason can be given
attributes.background: The roofs of commercial buildings could provide clean, cheap electricity to the grid. Frequently this space is not used for this purpose. Unless there are good reasons not to fit them, such as not fitting in with the local environment or bring prohibitevly expensive, they should be fitted.

attributes.action: Amend Microchip Regulations to require chip alerts for stolen dogs when scanned
attributes.background:
There is no method to raise an alert (where the dog is stolen) when a dog is scanned by a vet or authorised person.
When the data operators records show the dog as stolen, an alert should be made to the individual operating the microchip scanner to alert them to such. Confiscation laws introduced.
attributes.additional_details:
When a dog is scanned (i.e. by a veterinary practice) the only information being provided through the scanner is the microchip number. If the information included alert data which was recorded by the data operator, provided by the true keeper, this could help with the recovery of stolen dogs.
Police / RSPCA officers etc should be given scanners to support this and enable them to scan when they identify potentially vulnerable dogs.

attributes.action: Beat corporate tax avoidance by introducing Sales Tax based on Delivery Address
attributes.background: Big companies like Amazon, with turnovers in the UK in the billions, get away with paying next to no corporation tax.  Introduce a Delivery Sales Tax, based on the postcode being delivered to.  Claw back this money which is currently flowing overseas.  We could do this by monitoring at the courier.
attributes.additional_details:
It would be simple to legislate to require delivery companies to keep a log of:

a) Origin Company
b) Delivery Postcode
c) Declared value of item
d) Unique Shipping ID

Issue each company with an annual tax bill based on a fair percentage of the total value of all items delivered in the UK.

Failure to declare adequate value of a package would invalidate its insurance.

Spot checks would be simple - make occasional test orders to random addresses.  Incorrect declarations would be fined harshly.

attributes.action: Introduce a benefit payment to all diagnosis of cancer patients
attributes.background: When you are diagnosed with cancer your world is turned upside down for the patient and there familys many cancer victims are off work for long periods of time with no help from the government am asking the government to provide a benefit to help them fight this awful disease and make life easier
attributes.additional_details: Cancer is a five year programme and can return at anyone point during the five years

attributes.action: Increase the lowest maintenance loans from student finance.
attributes.background: This petition sets out to up the lowest maintenance loan but keep the highest loan where it is. Many students struggle with what they receive.
attributes.additional_details: The lowest loan you can get whilst living on your own is around £4000 a year, for me, this was not even enough to cover just my rent let alone food. Many people find themselves in the same situation where they struggle to get by and are forced to basically live on the breadline by the government. The minimum loan should be upped to £5500 to avoid students getting into their overdraft and debt before even leaving university to enter the working world.

attributes.action: Maternity hospitals to have separate buildings for parents of baby loss
attributes.background: Parents who are suffering baby loss whether it be miscarriage, still birth or ectopic, shouldn't have to go through the maternity hospital to get checked out or give birth. Many hospitals have separate wings but you're still in the maternity hospital which is full of babies, pregnancy and reminders.

attributes.action: 2 minute silence for teens lost their lives from knife crime
attributes.background: I would like to have 2minute silence once a year for all the teens who have lost their life to knife crime. The amount of teens loosing their lives is increasing daily. And it makes the news then not mentioned again. I feel each one should be always remembered
attributes.additional_details: As it stands today the total of lives lost to knife crime is 250. Let's keep their memories alive

attributes.action: Call for a global moratorium on deforestation.
attributes.background: While high-tech carbon dioxide removal solutions are under development, the “natural technology” of forests is currently the only proven means of removing and storing atmospheric CO2 at a scale that can meaningfully contribute to achieving carbon balance.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.climateandlandusealliance.org/scientists-statement/

attributes.action: Work with airlines and other countries to make all planes have disabled toilets
attributes.background: Why should disabled people only have short haul holidays and not drink on the flight? Surely this is discrimination. The UK Government must work with other countries to make airlines commit to making all planes accessible to disabled people.

attributes.action: Allow ESA / UC claimants to only go a maximum of 4 weeks without payment.
attributes.background: Employment Support Allowance / Universal credit in many cases is there to provide financial help to those who are unable to work due to physical / mental health conditions. During considerations, assessments and appeals etc. payments can unfortunately be put on hold for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details: The whole process causes a lot of unnecessary stress and financial strain to those affected. The time frame for this should be limited to 4 weeks maximum, as currently in many cases this can be ongoing for months when there is no need for it to take this long.

attributes.action: Make political education compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: In our politics class we have been debating the crisis of participation and the democratic deficit. We feel that a lack of political participation is caused partly by a lack of political education - so people don't understand how important it is to make their voice heard through voting.

attributes.action: Ensure all schools offer reception children a full time education from September
attributes.background: Every September many schools accept reception children for only part of a day for up to 6 weeks, causing enormous difficulties for many parents. Working parents have to take leave, unpaid leave in the case of self-employed parents, or pay huge childcare costs while the phased start is in place
attributes.additional_details:
There is little awareness of a ruling by the Schools Adjudicator in 2013 who said, in reference to phased starts, “It is not permissible in my view for a school to deny a child a term of full-time education. The school has a duty to provide a full-time place from September and cannot refuse to do so.”

The latest school admissions code supports this, stating that a local authority must make clear that children are entitled to a full-time place in the Sept following their fourth birthday.

attributes.action: Have another vote on leaving the EU. Canada-style agreement or no deal?
attributes.background: If the Chequers agreement is rejected, I feel the people should have a vote on what happens next, which is why I feel we should get a vote on the UK and EU agreeing an EU/Canada-style comprehensive economic and trade agreement or no deal.

attributes.action: Review the unfair school fine system where 2 parent families pay twice
attributes.background: The penalty for taking a child out of school is on a per person, per child basis. This means two parent families have to pay the fine twice. This is unfair and should be reviewed.

attributes.action: Introduce a statue of limitations for Army veterans
attributes.background: British Army veterans are being investigated for alleged wrongdoings that took place over 40 years ago in Northern Ireland , even though in many cases they were thoroughly investigated at the time . The introduction of a statute of limitations would prevent this from happening in the future .

attributes.action: Integrate Physical and Mental Health
attributes.background: It seems logical, but people can have both physical and mental health problems. Yet many mental health units do not allow for or accommodate physical health needs or disabilities. It's 2018, so surely we should be able to provide care for people with complex or multiple needs...
attributes.additional_details: I am detained in a mental health unit currently, and am often unable to take leave because I use a wheelchair and the hospital drive is too steep for a manual wheelchair. Many units are unable to accommodate wheelchair users at all, and those that do often struggle to provide equal access, consistent access to physio, or other adaptations. This may mean some young people, purely because of their physical health needs, are sent to elderly mental health wards! THIS NEEDS TO CHANGE!!!

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK remaining/leaving the Customs Union
attributes.background: In 2016 the British people voted to leave the EU . However there’s still no consensus on what form a Brexit can take which has caused much conflict on issues like trade and the Irish border .A simple solution would be to allow the electorate to decide if we leave or remain in the Customs Union.

attributes.action: Give full time members of the armed forces a council tax exemptions
attributes.background: Service personnel who live in a property that is not on a base have to pay council tax, however many of these due to where they are based actually live in these addresses minimally. they have to pay SILCOT the armed forces equivalent of council tax, as such they effectively pay double council tax

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoples’ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you needn’t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Increase the funding and support for the production of shale gas by fracking
attributes.background:
Fracking has the potential to boost the UK economy. It will increase job opportunities, lower imported fuel, whilst bringing a higher tax revenue with greater energy security.

The production of shale gas would reduce volatility within the wholesale market.
attributes.additional_details:
Local communities would see significant benefits from fracking economically with an increase of job opportunities. The first 100 sites could create 74,000 jobs.

Local communities which host sites will also be rewarded more directly. In June 2013, UKOOG announced its first industry-wide community benefits scheme where the local community will benefit to the sum of £100,000.

The industry estimates that it could add up to over £1.1bn in a 25 year period or about £5m to £10m per site.

attributes.action: Products containing toxic substances to animals display warning labels clearly
attributes.background: This Christmas we purchased a snow tipped tree. Nowhere on the information provided from the company selling this product did it say the paint used on the snow tips was toxic to animals. My kitten died suddenly from ingesting the toxin from the snow tips.

attributes.action: Ban Wild Animal Trophy’s entry into the UK
attributes.background: Ban Trophy Hunters bringing their murdered animals heads and skins into the UK. These creatures are being ‘hunted’ in ‘the wild’ for pleasure with considerable cruelty. The animals have no chance as the ‘hunts’ are set up by the land owners pruely for profit and the satisfaction of the most cruel.
attributes.additional_details:
A lion suffered incredible cruelty for at least 10 hours, severely wounded and slowly dying.
Clearly, although the wound was severe, the arrow had missed the vital organs or arteries that would have caused rapid blood loss and a relatively quick death.
Certainly, the lion was so incapacitated that in all those hours he'd been able to move only 350 meters from the place where he was shot.
Judging from the events described the injured lion most likely was killed 10/12 hours after being wounded.

attributes.action: Make LGBT+ Sex Ed. Compulsory In Secondary Schools.
attributes.background: Secondary schools often completely gloss over or fail to teach LGBT+ sexual education, leaving these students to feel isolated, unaccepted and unprepared. This can have a bad effect on both the mental and physical health of LGBT+ teens.
attributes.additional_details:
Just one in six LGBT+ young people have been taught about healthy same-sex relationships, and they are at a higher risk for substance abuse, STDs, bullying, anxiety and depression. Trans teens aren't properly taught on how to bind safety, leaving them at risk of permanent injury. 

(Sources: The CDC and Stonewall)

attributes.action: Funding help for clients attending private practice for mental health issues
attributes.background: Clients attend private practice for Counselling/Psychotherapy as advised by GP/NICE guidance and most need help with funding due to financial constraints. Long waiting lists of more than 6 months for charities and other voluntary services. Immediate intervention needed to prevent complex issues
attributes.additional_details: NICE guidance states that individuals struggling with mental health conditions such as anxiety and depression etc benefit from Counselling/Psychotherapy.  Early interventions and home treatment for mental health problems can reduce hospital admissions, shorten hospital stays and require fewer high-cost intensive interventions. This can potentially result in a saving of up to £38 million per year.

attributes.action: Make businesses label the environmental footprint of their products
attributes.background: I believe that businesses should be made to include a carbon footprint/ environmental impact score on their products, in the same way as food products have the traffic light health labels.
attributes.additional_details:
For consumers it can be so hard to know how good or bad different products are for the environment, and what can seem like a positive change (e.g. reduced plastic) can sometimes actually be worse in terms of environmental impact (e.g. more water or energy to produce). 
 
Having this sort of labelling will provide that insight so purchases can be more informed. It will also encourage manufacturers to do more to improve their practices so their eco scores are better than their competitors.

attributes.action: Ban Fireworks that are toxic to both the environment and humans!
attributes.background: To produce the oxygen needed for fireworks, many fireworks contain oxidisers known as perchlorates. These can dissolve in water, contaminating rivers, lakes and drinking water.
attributes.additional_details: "Fireworks get their flamboyance from a variety of chemicals, many of which are toxic to humans. From the gunpowder that fuels their flight to the metallic compounds that colour their explosions, fireworks often contain carcinogenic or hormone-disrupting substances that can seep into soil and water, not to mention the lung-clogging smoke they release and plastic debris they scatter."

attributes.action: Keep grants for plug-in hybrid & electric cars at their current levels or above
attributes.background: Sales of electric cars are starting to take off, but government action could stop it in its tracks. From 12 November onwards, the government will drop cash incentives even for the greenest plug-in hybrid cars. More seriously, the discount on full-electric vehicles will be cut from £4500 to £3500.
attributes.additional_details:
This action suggests the government doesn't care about the environment or encouraging adoption of low- and zero-emission vehicles. 

Nicholas Lyes from the RAC said the move was “a major blow to anyone hoping to go green with their next vehicle”. 

The AA's Jack Cousens: "This announcement will simply put more drivers off from buying greener cars."

More information 
Autocar -- https://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/industry/mitsubishi-extremely-disappointed-end-government-plug-car-grants

BBC -- https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45831150

Original announcement:
Gov.uk -- https://www.gov.uk/government/news/reformed-plug-in-car-grant-extended-into-next-decade

attributes.action: Give UK armed forces recognition of their service during the cold war
attributes.background: Give UK armed forces personnel the same recognition as the rest of the world has done for their service during the cold war by allowing a medal too be issued.
attributes.additional_details: For all personnel who served past and present.

attributes.action: Transfer the responsibility of A422 Brackley - Banbury to Highways England
attributes.background: The section of the A422 between Brackley and Banbury is used quite heavily by all forms of transport at the moment the road is under Northamptonshire Highways, and not Highways England, plans for a Farthinghoe By Pass have yet to materialise.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the road is closed for a small bridge repair near Farthinghoe.
Which  is causing chaos with minor roads unsuitable for use of high traffic volumes. The road is also a diversion route for M40 Traffic from Junction 10 to 11 vice versa when road accidents occur on the motorway between those junctions.

attributes.action: Urge Saudi government to reduce pilgrimage fees
attributes.background: The British government should help British Muslims by passing the message to the Saudi government that British Muslims are not happy with the Umrah fee. Not every Muslim can’t afford to pay the extra fee
attributes.additional_details: Umrah is a spiritual journey for every Muslim all around the world, but for the last two years the Saudi government has made it harder for Muslims. It’s British parliament responsibility to raise our views with the Saudi government.

attributes.action: Give students free dental care and prescriptions on the NHS
attributes.background: Most students do not have any income, or if they do it is very minimal. Most students cannot afford dental treatment or prescriptions and avoid going to the doctors or dentist. This can mean that medical problems can go untreated and thus cost the NHS more in the long term.

attributes.action: Make nutrition a mandatory subject for children to learn in schools.
attributes.background: Making nutrition a mandatory subject in schools will help in the growing obesity rates in children and adults, this will lead to less of a strain on the NHS in the future.
